subject: Relationships
title: Complex PTSD from Toxic Relationships
description: A micro-lesson that makes Complex PTSD from Toxic Relationships usable.

hook.text: She left two years ago. She still flinches when someone raises their voice. The relationship ended; the trauma didn't.

buildup.text: Complex PTSD develops from prolonged, repeated trauma ‚Äî exactly the conditions of a long-term toxic relationship.

discovery.text: Symptoms include hypervigilance, emotional flashbacks, difficulty trusting, and chronic shame.

twist.text: Standard PTSD treatment often misses it. Complex PTSD needs specialized, longer-term therapeutic approaches.

climax.text: Leaving is the first step. Healing the nervous system the relationship rewired takes much longer ‚Äî but it's possible.

punchline.text: Leaving ends the relationship. Healing the rewired nervous system takes longer.
